conclusion: A, B, and C are the starting points for the liquid flow.
The yellow liquid flows downwards from Point A.
The yellow liquid encounters a horizontal bar that redirects it downward.
The yellow liquid continues until it meets a black bar that directs it towards the right side.
The yellow liquid flows into Container E.
The blue liquid flows downwards from Point B.
The blue liquid encounters a horizontal bar.
The blue liquid continues until it meets the same black bar as Point A.
The blue liquid flows into Container E.
The green liquid flows downwards from Point C.
The green liquid encounters a horizontal bar.
The green liquid flows towards the black bar and joins the flow from Points A and B.
The green liquid flows into Container E.
All paths from Points A, B, and C lead to Container E.
The liquid from Points A, B, and C will flow into Container E.
